body_html:
So I'm still a little concerned with possible performance implications of returning the value tensor in the update op. Unlike the values returned by other streaming metrics, this value could potentially be a very large tensor. Is there any chance that copying a local variable like this into numpy could require a memory copy?
…
On Wed, Jan 11, 2017 at 4:07 PM drpngx ***@***.***> wrote: Oh, good point! Any volunteer for changing the actual returned value? — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#6498 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABKS1hMhwC_M5_HSo8Arn-hjucQ3AiHCks5rRW6tgaJpZM4LVs1E> .

body:
So I'm still a little concerned with possible performance implications of
returning the value tensor in the update op. Unlike the values returned by
other streaming metrics, this value could potentially be a very large
tensor. Is there any chance that copying a local variable like this into
numpy could require a memory copy?
On Wed, Jan 11, 2017 at 4:07 PM drpngx <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Oh, good point!
>
> Any volunteer for changing the actual returned value?
>
> —
